titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Developing Countries Program, Rural Poverty and Resources, Office Files of Katherine McKee
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Developing Countries Program, Rural Poverty and Resources, Office Files of Katherine McKee FA637

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-10-04 02:58:48 -0400.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Developing Countries Program, Rural Poverty and Resources, Office Files of Katherine McKee

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Level 1 Minimal Processing has been conducted to establish basic intellectual and physical control of the material and assess immediate preservation and conservation needs. Material remains as received, in original folders and storage boxes.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at https://rockarch.org/collections/access-and-request-materials/#citations

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Beginning in the 1950s, the Ford Foundation has provided funds to improve the management of land and water, to strengthen policy making for the rural sector and to generate off-farm employment and income, especially for women. In addition, the Foundation supports efforts to increase the productivity of agriculture and to strengthen rural development organizations.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Katherine "Kate" McKee is a development economist who worked for several years at the Ford Foundation. McKee joined the Foundation in 1978 as an Assistant Program Officer in its West Africa Program. She then moved to the Rural Poverty and Resources Program where she worked for several years as a Program Officer.

McKee has served in a number of senior development economics positions since leaving the Ford Foundation. Between 1986 and 1998, she worked as a senior manager at Self-Help in Durham, North Carolina. After that, she directed the Microenterprise Development Office at the United States Agency for International Development (USAID). She joined the Consultative Group to Assist the Poor (CGAP) as a Senior Policy Advisor in 2006, and in 2017, she was appointed Executive Director of the Partnership for Economic Inclusion (PEI).
McKee completed her undergraduate education at Bowdoin College in 1976 and earned a Master's Degree in public and international affairs from Princeton University in 1978.
